website_summaries.verdict: A fairly light circular saw that offers enough power for most DIY jobs along with desired safety features like a guard and brake.
pros: Fairly lightweight and easy to control
Users can see cutting guides from either side of the saw
Brake is a welcome safety feature
Blades are easy to swap out
cons: Keyed chuck adds time to blade changes, and key could get lost
Doesn’t fit well in its included case

customer_reviews.title: this is the best non-track-saw circular saw that I've used
customer_reviews.text: So far, this is the best non-track-saw circular saw that I've used. It is significantly more expensive than other similarly sized saws, but that only hurts at checkout time. Those lesser saws are a pain every time you use them. This one comes with a decent blade, cuts straight, brakes quickly, has a substantial base that is square to the blade, and despite what some of the reviewers indicate has a good sized case with room for several extra blades. I would buy it again, but I expect that the only reason I would need to is theft.
customer_reviews.author: R Hanby

customer_reviews.title: Too good to be true.  But it is!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot say enough about this saw. It is precise, balanced, powerful. It cuts a perfect 45 or 22.5. It has changed the way I build cabinets. Some of my cuts, of course, are done with guides. But this saw follows a guide like no other in its price range, or really, any price range.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Campbell

customer_reviews.title: I break brand loyalty for this one...
customer_reviews.text: I am a Milwaukee guy. I have an entire Milwaukee line up. I love this saw. It is hands down better than all the other saws I have owned. Dewalt, porter cable, and Milwaukee... The electric break was worth the extra money. I always liked the handle placement of Makita saws over other brands. It is a workhorse. I love the LED light that illuminates the way. All levers and knobs are sized and positioned in a way that makes adjustments easy. Sure there are cheaper saws out there. This one will last me a lifetime. Also, the box for storage is great. It has a place to store extra saw blades and keeps thing all nice and tidy.

Hypoid is 4 lb heavier and blade is on left side. i am right handed and used to step on a piece of 2x4 by my left leg and cut 2x4 with the saw on the right. i could sit this saw on the 2x4. i could not do the same for hypoid. i use it occasionally at home, so my opinion does not apply for those who use saw daily. my 2 cents.
customer_reviews.author: John CA

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, Powerful, Well built Saw
customer_reviews.text: A lot more power than my 30 year, wore out Craftsman. It is almost too powerful...Getting older (and weaker) I was surprised with the power of this saw when it kicked back while cutting on a sheet of plywood. Hold on tight...I'm pretty big and was caught off guard (even after I had read another post stating same thing)! I am not a professional and do not intend to use it for anything more than home repairs. The saw will work great for my needs...I'll just remember to hang on tightly!
customer_reviews.author: Jane

product_meta.title: Makita 5007MGA 7-1/4" Magnesium Circular Saw, with Electric Brake, Teal
product_meta.description:
The Makita 5007MGA 7-1/4 in. Magnesium Circular saw with Electric brake features highly durable magnesium components and a powerful 15 amp Makita-built industrial motor. The 5007MGA seamlessly balances weight, Power, durability, and ease of use, making it the most refined Circular saw on the market. A built-in dust blower clears the line of cut for more accurate and precise cuts.

AMAZON.COM
The Makita 7-1/4-Inch Magnesium Circular Saw with Electric Brake features highly durable magnesium components and a powerful 15 AMP Makita-built industrial motor. The 5007MGA seamlessly balances weight, power, durability, and ease of use, making it the most refined circular saw on the market.





View larger5007MGA FeaturesDURABILITY - Magnesium components create a saw with less weight (10.1 lbs.) -- that's jobsite tough!POWER - 15 AMP motor delivers enough power to cut through the densest lumberEFFICIENCY - Large cutting capacity (2-1/2" at 90°) with positive stops at 22.5°, 45° and 56°PERFORMANCE - Electric brake for maximum productivityINCLUDES - Carbide tipped blade, rip fence, wrench and case

Tool SpecificationsBlade Diameter7-1/4"Arbor5/8"Max. Cutting Capacity at 90°2-1/2"Max. Cutting Capacity at 45°1-3/4"No Load Speed5,800 RPMWatts out2,300AMPS (120V)15.0Length12-1/2"Net Weight (lbs.)10.1Makita-Built Motor Engineered for Versatile Power
The 5007MGA features a Makita-built 15 AMP industrial motor that delivers 5,800 RPM, combined with well-balanced magnesium components for a lighter weight saw that delivers true power the professional user demands. The saw has a large cutting capacity (2-1/2 inches at 90°) with a maximum bevel capacity of 56° and positive stops at 22.5° and 45° for quick back-and-forth changes. The 5007MGA includes an electric brake to stop the blade quickly for maximum productivity.Ergonomic and Ease-of-Use
Features Magnesium components allowed Makita to engineer a saw with less weight (10.1 pounds) that is well-balanced and jobsite tough. Additional design details include greater clearance between the rear handle and the blade case to provide a better grip for larger hands or for users with gloves, as well as a wider space between the blade and housing for a clearer view of the blade and measurement scale. The saw features twin L.E.D. lights for better illumination, as well as ducting designed to blow dust away from the line of cut. Makita also engineered ergonomics and ease-of-use into the saw, including clearly visible depth and bevel markings and ergonomic hand grips to improve overall control while minimizing operator fatigue. The large rubberized levers provide quick, one-handed adjustments for more efficient work.

Includes Ultra-Coated Framing Blade
The 5007MGA includes a Makita 7-1/4-Inch Premium Ultra-Coated Framing Blade with Advance Tooth Design. The "M" shaped tooth design features a two-pointed tip and two 10° bevel faces to maximize cutting performance for a faster, cleaner and longer lasting cut. The carbide tips are specifically set to withstand the harshest conditions such as plowing through nail-embedded wood. The blade is also ultra-coated to reduce heat and pitch build-up for faster, smoother cutting, with special Makita heat vents strategically set to dissipate heat and increase performance. The 5007MGA also include a blade wrench attached to the saw for fast and convenient blade changing.

Engineered for a Range of Applications
The 5007MGA is built for framing walls, floors and roofs using a range of dimensional lumber and dense engineered lumber, including LVL, PSL and I-Joists, headers, and microlams; as well as ripping panels such as plywood, OSB, particle board, and dense structural panels. Other applications include plunge and bevel cutting, as well as masonry and metal cutting. The 5007MGA is just another example of Makita's commitment to innovative technology and best-in-class engineering.

About Makita's Magnesium Series
Magnesium components are stronger and lighter than conventional materials, resulting in saws that weigh less with improved ergonomic features. There's plenty of power thanks to Makita engineering, and a precision balanced design that delivers clean, accurate cuts.

About Makita
Makita is a worldwide manufacturer of industrial quality power tools and offers a wide range of industrial accessories. Makita applies leading-edge innovation to engineer power tools that are more compact and energy efficient, yet deliver industrial strength power and results. Makita U.S.A., Inc. is located in La Mirada, California, and operates an extensive distribution network located throughout the U.S. For more information, please call 800/4-MAKITA (800/462-5482) or visit makitatools.com. Makita is Best in Class Engineering.

Warranty
Every Makita tool is thoroughly inspected and tested before leaving the factory. If you are not satisfied with any Makita tool within 30 days of purchase, return it and Makita will provide a replacement or refund. Each Makita tool is warranted to be free of defects from workmanship and materials for the period of ONE YEAR from the date of original purchase. Should any trouble develop during this one-year period, return the COMPLETE tool, freight prepaid, to one of Makita's Factory or Authorized Service Centers. Please see makitatools.com for complete details.

What's in the Box
Makita 5007MGA 7-1/4-Inch Magnesium Circular Saw, 24T carbide-tipped framing blade, hex blade wrench, rip fence and tool case.


FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Most refined saw with magnesium components for less weight, better balance and jobsite durability. With a proven 15 amp motor this saw is powerful enough to cut through the densest lumber. Two built-in LED lights illuminates the line of cut for increased accurancy. Includes: carbide tipped blade, hex blade wrench, rip fence and tool case.
